![Ansan Botanical Garden (안산식물원)](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593518_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Opened in 2001, the Ansan Botanical Garden has three halls. The first hall (382.81㎡) is a tropical garden, home to 98 species, including palm trees. The second hall (846㎡) features 177 species in 11 families of floral plants, such as irises. The third hall (846㎡) features 177 species in 4 families of marsh plants. Outside gardens include a rose garden, fruit tree garden, wild plant garden, plant succession garden, and a pond featuring a total of 46 plants including red momo botan lotus. The botanical park has a pyramid-shaped, modern greenhouse that is a source of pride for Ansan City. The park is also connected to Seongho Park. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |accomcount:|1,000 people| |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-31-481-3168| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|The day of Seollal (Lunar New Year's Day) & Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving Day)| |usetime:|Winter season 10:00-17:00 / Summer season 10:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Admission Fees:|Free| |Available Facilities:|Greenhouses, outdoor gardens, etc.| |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593515_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593515_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593516_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593516_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593517_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593517_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593519_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593519_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593520_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-17-1658097788788/1593520_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [☎️+82-31-481-3168](tel:+82314813168) ```googleMap latitude: 37.3141314343 longitude: 126.8602333149 title: 113, Seongho-ro, Sangnok-gu, Ansan-si, Gyeonggi-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take Bus No. 11 or 11-2 from Suwon Station (Seoul Subway Line 1), Exit 4

data.title: Ansan Botanical Garden (안산식물원)
data.description: Opened in 2001, the Ansan Botanical Garden has three halls. The first hall (382.81㎡) is a tropical garden, home to 98 species, including palm trees. The second hall (846㎡) features 177 species in 11 families of floral plants, such as irises. The third hall (846㎡) features 177 species in 4 families of marsh plants. Outside gardens include a rose garden, fruit tree garden, wild plant garden, plant succession garden, and a pond featuring a total of 46 plants including red momo botan lotus. The botanical park has a pyramid-shaped, modern greenhouse that is a source of pride for Ansan City. The park is also connected to Seongho Park.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jatyanggi Purunsup Resort (잣향기푸른숲)
dataList.description: Located in Gyeonggi-do and home to the nation's largest nut pine forest, composed of trees over 80 years old, Jatyanggi Purunsup Resort is a special recreational forest complex where phytoncide emitted from the pine tree forest creates a healing experience. The forest is located between 450 and 600 meters above sea level on Chungnyeongsan and Seorisan Mountains.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jarasum Island (자라섬)
dataList.description: Located in Gapyeong, Gyeonggi-do, Jarasum Island is an island formed on the Bukhangang River as a result of the construction of the Cheongpyeong Dam in 1943. The name ‘Jarasum’ comes from the fact that it faces a hill that resembles a Jara (Korean word for soft-shelled turtle). Jarasum consists of four islands called Dongdo, Seodo, Jungdo, and Namdo, and has various leisure and park facilities. Visitors can find a car camping site and the filming location of the popular TV drama series 'Iris' on Seodo (west island), and an eco-cultural park with a grass plaza of over 100 meters in diameter on Jungdo (central island). There is also an ecosystem theme park called Ehwawon Garden at the westernmost tip of the Jarasum Campground. A popular camping spot, Jaraseom Island is also widely known as the venue of the annual Jarasum International Jazz Festival.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jangja Lake Park (장자호수공원)
dataList.description:
Guri City worked to improve the water quality of Jangja Lake in order to form the Jangja Lake Park and in the process an ecological zone was created. A 3.6 km tree-lined walking trail runs through the park and is frequently used by people enjoying an outing or getting some light exercise. Concerts, exhibitions, and other events are held on the outdoor stage on weekends and the park is widely used as a place to relax by local residents.

* Size - Area 107,385 m², average water depth 2.2 m (0.2 m~4.7 m), and walkway 4.6 km
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Janganmun Gate (장안문)
dataList.description: Janganmun Gate is the main gate of Hwaseong Fortress at the northern wall. Jangan means capital, implying that Hwaseong Fortress is the secondary capital. Janganmun Gate served as the main gate because the king would pass from this gate when arriving from Hanyang, the capital city, now modern-day Seoul. It is interesting to note that this gate is larger than Sungryemun Gate in Seoul.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Imjingak Resort (파주 임진각(평화누리공원))
dataList.description: Located approximately 56 kilometers from Seoul City Hall and 7 kilometers from DMZ, Imjingak is an important part of Korean history. Imjingak Resort has various war-related artifacts as well as spacious Pyeonghwa Nuri Park. The resort preserves the Freedom Bridge and Imjingang rail bridge from the Korean War to remind people of the past, along with a Memorial Hall, memorial monuments and recreational areas.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ilyeong Herbland (일영허브랜드)
dataList.description: Ilyeong Herbland offers picturesque scenery, combining both natural and man-made beauty with herbal gardens resting on a wide outdoor field. Ilyeong Herbland is comprised of an herbal botanical garden, herbal shop, well-being corner, restaurant, outdoor garden, and walking paths. Visitors can buy herbal plants and can also have various herbal teas and boiled rice with herbal flowers.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ilsan Lake Park (일산호수공원)
dataList.description: Ilsan Lake Park spans over 991,800 square meters, making it one of the largest man-made parks in Asia. The large fresh water lake is well-managed to remain clean. The park is equipped with convenient facilities and attractions, including the Riverside Square, artificial islands, a 4.7-kilometer-long bike path, children’s playground, natural experience site, musical fountain, 100 species of wild flowers and a dense forest of 200,000 trees. The park also serves as the venue for International Horticulture Goyang Korea, a large flower exhibition.
dataList.author: korea-tour
